meanings.definition: to perform an action incorrectly or inappropriately.
meanings.sent1: She misacts by pressing the wrong button on the remote.
meanings.sent2: He often misacts when trying to follow complicated instructions.
meanings.sent3: The robot misacts by dancing instead of cleaning the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her mind misacts like a tangled string, making simple tasks seem impossible.
meanings.sent5: The child misacts in a way that always leads to funny outcomes.

meanings.definition: actions that are done incorrectly or inappropriately.
meanings.sent1: The misacts of the students caused confusion in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The misacts of the chef resulted in a burnt dinner.
meanings.sent3: The misacts of the clown made the audience laugh even harder.
meanings.sent4: His misacts were like a series of unfortunate events, one after another.
meanings.sent5: The misacts of the puppy left a trail of chaos throughout the house.
